title: Drawing, 1881
medium: Pen and brown ink on tan laid paper
markings:
Watermark:portion of mark visible at center of top:(see drawn description on catalogue card)
Stamped in ink, lower right: "Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union."
inscribed:
Recto: inscribed in pen and brown ink, along lower left: Green inside Blue [color notations for boats]
Verso: inscribed in graphite, upper right corner: (4).
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Horizontal view of a life brigade house and railing shown at left with three beached rowboats in front. Figures visible inside house looking out to turbulent sea at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1881.
1881. Pen and brown ink on tan laid paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-4.
